Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
model.GameModel
public class GameModel extends Object
Primary game model that holds the entire game state and logic.

Responsibilities include:

  • maintaining the tile map and entities (hero, drones, bombs, powerups),
  • level setup and deterministic destructible placement,
  • handling bomb explosions and drone damage,
  • managing hero lives, respawn, and game-over state,
  • progression between levels and spawning exit/powerups/drones.
The model is intentionally defensive and attempts to delegate some actions (e.g., tile destruction) so rendering and scoring are kept consistent.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameModel

      public GameModel(KeyHandler keyH)
      Constructs the GameModel with the provided KeyHandler.

      This initializes the tile map from inputMap, the hero, collision checker, and immediately starts the level setup.

      Parameters:
      keyH - the KeyHandler used to read player input

  • Method Details

    • showMessage

      public void showMessage(String txt)
      Shows an onscreen/debug message for a short duration.
      Parameters:
      txt - the text to show; ignored if null

    • initializeTiles

      public void initializeTiles()
      Initializes the tiles[][] array from the original inputMap.

      Converts characters into specific Tile subclasses (IndestructibleTile, DestructibleTile, WalkableTile, BarrierTile) and preserves the exact input map layout.

    • update

      public void update(double delta)
      Updates the entire game model each frame tick.

      The update includes hero updates, drone updates and collision checks, walking bomb updates, bomb countdowns, powerup pickup handling, and housekeeping such as removing exploded bombs.

      Parameters:
      delta - time elapsed since last update (game time unit)

    • handleHeroDeath

      public void handleHeroDeath()
      Handles hero death: decrement hearts, respawn if possible, or end the game.

      This method checks invulnerability and delegates respawn or game over logic.

    • destroyTile

      public void destroyTile(int row, int col)
      Destroys a destructible tile at the specified coordinates. If a destructible tile is destroyed, handleTileDestroyed is called. ALWAYS spawns a powerup (when powerupsPlaced invalid input: '<' powerupsToPlace).
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the tile to destroy
      col - the column index of the tile to destroy

    • handleTileDestroyed

      public void handleTileDestroyed(int row, int col)
      Called when a destructible tile is destroyed. increments counters, spawns exit if threshold reached, awards points.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index that was destroyed
      col - the column index that was destroyed

    • spawnExitAt

      public void spawnExitAt(int row, int col)
      Spawns an exit at the given tile coordinates.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index for the exit
      col - the column index for the exit

    • onHeroReachExit

      public void onHeroReachExit()
      Called when the hero reaches the exit tile — advances level if present.

    • advanceLevel

      public void advanceLevel()
      Advances the player to the next level or marks completion if final level reached.

      This method resets necessary counters, clears bombs and drones, respawns the hero, and calls startLevel(int) for the new level.

    • checkDroneDamageAt

      public int checkDroneDamageAt(int row, int col)
      Destroys drones that are inside explosion cross of (row,col). Marks drones as dead (so death sprite can display) and awards points per drone destroyed. Returns number of drones marked.
      Parameters:
      row - the center row of the explosion
      col - the center column of the explosion
      Returns:
      number of drones marked as dead

    • explodeAt

      public void explodeAt(int centerR, int centerC, int radius)
      Executes an explosion at the given center and radius following destruction rules.

      Rules:

      • Center is processed unless out of bounds or indestructible.
      • Propagation stops at indestructible tiles ('I').
      • On encountering a destructible tile ('D') that direction destroys it and stops.
      • Damages drones and the hero if inside the explosion cross.
      Parameters:
      centerR - center row for explosion
      centerC - center column for explosion
      radius - number of tiles to propagate in each cardinal direction

    • spawnDrone

      public void spawnDrone(int col, int row)
      Convenience helper to spawn a drone at a given tile coordinate (col, row). Tile coordinates are expected (col = column index, row = row index). This method will only add a drone if the tile is valid/walkable and not too close to the hero.
      Parameters:
      col - tile column to spawn at
      row - tile row to spawn at

    • startLevel

      public void startLevel(int level)
      Starts the specified level: reinitializes map, places destructible tiles deterministically, sets required crates thresholds, and spawns drones/powerups for the level.
      Parameters:
      level - the level index to start (1..maxLevel)

    • spawnFastDrone

      public void spawnFastDrone(int col, int row)
